0.title: 6 killed, including 2 girls aged 6 and 11, in landslides in Karnataka
0.article_body: Six persons were killed in Karnataka's Uttara Kannada and Dakshina Kannada districts due to landslides inflicted by heavy rains. In Uttara Kannada, four of a family were killed after a part of a hill collapsed on their house. Meanwhile, in Dakshina Kannada, the bodies of two sisters, Shruthi (11) and Jnanashree (6), were found holding their hands together, police said.

1.title: Suvendu Adhikari briefs Amit Shah on West Bengal SSC scam
1.article_body: West Bengal Leader of Opposition Suvendu Adhikari met Home Minister Amit Shah in the Parliament today. He briefed him about the teachers recruitment scam and other issues. "I briefed him how Bengal is completely mired in corrupt activities such as the teachers recruitment scam. Also requested him to implement CAA at the earliest," Adhikari tweeted after the meet.

2.title: I-T Department raids premises of Tamil film producer Anbu Chezhiyan
2.article_body: The Income Tax Department is conducting raids at 40 locations linked to Tamil film producer GN Anbu Chezhiyan for alleged tax evasion. According to reports, raids started this morning at 6 am on 30 properties, including his home in Madurai and 10 locations in Chennai. He has been under the IT radar since February 2020, reports added.

3.title: Taking action against dubious digital loan apps: Sitharaman to RS
3.article_body: Union Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman informed Rajya Sabha that the Centre is taking action against dubious digital loan apps. "Only a couple of months ago...in Telangana, a lot of people have been put to harassment and action has been initiated," Sitharaman said. She added that the government is also taking action against Indians who assist in establishing these companies.

4.title: Priyanka Chopra 'lost' her Miss World gown during travel, says the actress
4.article_body: Actress Priyanka Chopra revealed in a new interview that her strapless bejewelled gown that she wore when she was crowned Miss World 2000, was lost "in her many travels". The actress told People magazine that 'she wished she had kept' the gown. "I was always a nomad. I moved around so much, especially in the last 15 years," she added.

5.title: Mumbai woman missing for 20 years found in Pak using social media
5.article_body: A 70-year-old woman from Mumbai, who went missing 20 years ago after emigrating for work, has been traced to Pakistan with the help of social media. As per reports, the woman recently connected with her family in Kurla after moving out of Mumbai in 2002, when she was allegedly cheated by an agent with the promise of employment in Dubai.

6.title: Sambit Patra criticises Opposition for backing Sanjay Raut
6.article_body: BJP leader Sambit Patra criticised Opposition leaders for supporting Shiv Sena MP Sanjay Raut, who was arrested by the Enforcement Directorate in an alleged land scam case. “Entire India is seeing the manner in which the Opposition is doing politics over corruption," said Patra. The Shiv Sena MP has been sent to ED custody till August 4.

7.title: Edtech startup OckyPocky raises funds from Silicon Valley-based ventures
7.article_body: OckyPocky, an interactive English learning application, has secured an undisclosed amount in seed funding from Silicon Valley-based Goodwater Capital and AngelList Quant Fund, company's founder Amit Agrawal said. The startup, founded in 2017, aims to use funds to grow content for a wider vernacular audience. Udaan Co-founder Sujeet Kumar and SucSEED Indovation Fund are also among its investors.

8.title: Hyderabad receives heavy rains; roads waterlogged & traffic affected
8.article_body: Heavy rains lashed Hyderabad on Tuesday, causing waterlogging and affecting traffic. The traffic movement was disrupted in areas like Khairatabad, Punjagutta, Banjara Hills, Jubilee Hills, Secunderabad, Mehdipatnam, Ameerpet and LB Nagar. The traffic police asked the people to not immediately start their journey after the stoppage of rain and wait for one to two hours.

9.title: New traffic sign spotted on Bengaluru road, traffic police explain its meaning
9.article_body: A man spotted an unusual road sign in Bengaluru and shared a picture on Twitter requesting traffic police to explain its usage. Whitefield traffic police responded, "That is a cautionary sign board which tells about a possible blind person likely on the road. Exercise caution while driving. There is a blind school at Hopefarm junction where this board is placed."

10.title: Monkeypox not a new disease, no need to fear it: Mandaviya
10.article_body: Union Health Minister Dr Mansukh Mandaviya on Tuesday said that monkeypox is not a new disease and asserted that India was taking a step-by-step approach to deal with it. "Before the first case in Kerala, we had issued guidelines to all the states," he said. There's no need to fear the virus, Mandaviya added.

11.title: Hardik Pandya is two players in one and is a luxury: McGrath
11.article_body: Praising Hardik Pandya, Glenn McGrath said the India all-rounder is two players in one and is a luxury to have. "Hardik is very much a confident player. If he's bowling well, it has a positive impact on his batting...he is a good, intelligent bowler and powerful hitter," he added. Hardik is currently playing in five-match T20I series against West Indies.

12.title: Guj youths with high IELTS score fail to speak in English in US court
12.article_body: A probe was launched in Gujarat's Mehsana district to unearth an illegal racket of helping ineligible college aspirants acquire high International English Language Testing System (IELTS) scores. This comes as four youths from Gujarat, who were arrested near the US-Canada border, were unable to converse in English in a US court. They had scored 6.5 to 7 bands in IELTS.

13.title: Pic shows giant hybrid fish caught by fisherman in US, people comment 'What a monster'
13.article_body: A US fisherman recently caught an enormous tiger muskie in Connecticut's Lake Lillinonah. Taking to Facebook, the Connecticut Fish and Wildlife shared its image and wrote, "The tiger muskie is a cross between a northern pike and a muskellunge." Reacting to it, a person wrote, "I don't want to swim anywhere anymore," while another comment read, "What a monster!"

14.title: Wimbledon winner Elena loses in 1st round in San Jose; blames packed schedule
14.article_body: Wimbledon 2022 women's singles champion Elena Rybakina made a first-round exit from the Silicon Valley Classic in San Jose on Monday. This was the 23-year-old tennis player's first match after winning the Wimbledon final. "It was a tough week after Wimbledon... I had a lot of travelling. I didn't have enough time to prepare for the hard season," Rybakina said.

15.title: Over 10 mn people crossed border from Ukraine since war began: UN
15.article_body: More than 10 million people have crossed the border from Ukraine since the war began, the UN Refugee Agency said on Tuesday. Russia began invading Ukraine on February 24. As per the Ukrainian Foreign Ministry, the country's forces have killed about 41,170 Russian soldiers and destroyed 1,768 Russian tanks and more than 410 aircraft, including 191 helicopters, so far.

16.title: 32-year-old woman attacked over ₹200 at Kalyan station, 2 arrested
16.article_body: A 32-year-old woman was injured after she was allegedly attacked with a sharp blade by two men at Kalyan railway station after she refused to give them ₹200. The accused were identified as Khwaja Shaikh and Rahim Shaikh, both 30 years old. "The CCTV had captured the entire incident based on which we arrested the two," a police official said.

17.title: Incorrect: Jackky on report saying Akshay & Tiger reduce fees for 'Bade...'
17.article_body: Producer Jackky Bhagnani has reacted to a report claiming that Akshay Kumar and Tiger Shroff have reduced their acting fees for 'Bade Miyan Chote Miyan', following the failure of their last films at the box office. The report also claimed that the film was put on hold due to budgeting issues. Reacting to claims, Jackky tweeted, "Absolutely Incorrect!!"

18.title: Guj woman's hands transplanted in TN man, he promises her mother to take care of tattoos
18.article_body: The hands of a 26-year-old brain dead woman from Ahmedabad were successfully transplanted in a 24-year-old man from Tamil Nadu who lost both his hands due to electrical burns in 2018. The man said the woman's mother broke down seeing the tattoos on her daughter's hands and he promised to take care of them for the rest of his life.

19.title: I'm not convinced it'll last: Lopez's 1st husband on her marriage with Affleck
19.article_body: Ojani Noa, first husband of Jennifer Lopez, spoke about her fourth marriage with Ben Affleck and said he's not convinced that their marriage will last. According to him, Lopez will be married "seven or eight times". "I can't see her...settling down with one person...She pushes herself to constantly go forward in...professional life...but she also moves on in...private life," Ojani added.

20.title: CAA to be implemented after COVID vaccine drive: Shah to Bengal BJP
20.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah on Tuesday assured the West Bengal unit of the BJP that the Citizenship Amendment Act (CAA) will be implemented once the precaution vaccine dose drive for COVID-19 is completed. Shah said this to West Bengal Leader of Opposition and BJP MLA Suvendu Adhikari when the latter said that the situation in the state was 'critical'.

21.title: Man jumps from 1st floor of court building to escape police, injured
21.article_body: An undertrial, Raju Kumar, sustained injuries after he jumped from the first floor of a court building in Gurugram on Monday in a bid to escape police custody, officials said. Kumar is being treated at the civil hospital for his injuries. A fresh FIR has been registered against him for trying to flee, the officials added.

22.title: Advocate dragged out of car, stabbed to death in T'gana's Mulugu
22.article_body: An advocate, Malla Reddy, was waylaid, dragged out of his car and stabbed to death on Monday evening in Telangana's Mulugu district. Malla Reddy's driver told the police that the assailants were wearing clinical masks and dragged the lawyer to the bushes by the roadside. "We...know that there are 10 cases, mostly land disputes, registered against Reddy," police said.

23.title: 15 suspected patients test negative for Monkeypox in Maharashtra
23.article_body: At least 15 samples of suspected monkeypox infection have tested negative for the disease in Maharashtra, a senior health official said on Monday. "So far, not a single positive case has been found in the state," Dr Pradeep Awate, the state's surveillance officer, said. The samples were sent to the National Institute of Virology (NIV) in Pune.

24.title: Baha'i individuals arrested for links with Israel, says Iran
24.article_body: Iran on Monday said it had arrested multiple followers of the banned Baha'i faith for links to a centre in Israel, state media reported. The individuals have also been accused of proselytising, reports said. Notably, the Baha'i International Community, whose governing council operates from Israel, had informed about the arrests of "a significant number of Baha'is" in Iran.

25.title: 2 dead, 4 critically ill after consuming spurious liquor in Bihar
25.article_body: At least two persons died and four others fell critically ill after they allegedly consumed suspected spurious liquor in Bihar's Saran, as per reports. The victims had reportedly gone for a liquor party after finishing their work on Monday evening. "When my husband returned at night, he started vomiting," the wife of one of the victims said.

26.title: PM's brother stages dharna in Delhi with fair price shop dealers' demands
26.article_body: PM Narendra Modi's brother Prahlad Modi on Tuesday staged a dharna in Delhi with various demands raised by the All India Fair Price Shop Dealers' Federation. Prahlad Modi, who is the vice president of the organisation, was joined by other members. Among other demands, they are demanding that the 'West Bengal Ration Model' of free distribution be implemented across India.

27.title: WB Ministers don't pick calls even if we ring 10 times: Minister
27.article_body: Union Minister Pratima Bhoumik, while replying to queries on the implementation of a Central government scheme in West Bengal, said that Ministers in the state don't pick up calls even when called 10 times. Bhoumik said that she has been trying to distribute appliances worth ₹12 crore to differentially-abled and senior citizens in the district but has been unsuccessful.

28.title: Avendus Future Leaders Fund buys stake for ₹195 cr in Xpressbees
28.article_body: Avendus Future Leaders Fund has bought a minority stake in logistics firm Xpressbees for ₹195 crore from Elevation Capital, the company said in a statement. This is the sixth investment from  Avendus Future Leaders Fund II that has assets under management of as much as ₹1,500 crore. In February, Xpressbees raised $300 million in a funding round.

29.title: 3 held for cheating people in Gurugram: Police
29.article_body: Three members of a gang that cheated people by assuring them home delivery of liquor were arrested, Gurugram Police said on Monday. The accused also cheated people on pretext of buying and selling vehicles online, a police official said. "It has been found that they have cheated people to the tune of ₹25 lakh in...last 15 days," the official added.

30.title: Who is 'Most Wanted' terrorist al-Adel, likely to be al-Qaeda's next chief?
30.article_body: FBI 'Most Wanted Terrorist' Saif al-Adel is likely to be the next chief of al-Qaeda after Ayman al-Zawahiri was killed in a US drone strike, the Middle East Institute reported. He's a former Egyptian Army officer and is wanted in the 1998 US embassy bombings which led to 250 deaths. The explosive expert was earlier affiliated with Egyptian Islamic Jihad.

31.title: Russia warns US over Pelosi's 'purely provocative' visit to Taiwan
31.article_body: Russia on Tuesday warned the US that an expected visit by US House Speaker Nancy Pelosi to Taiwan would put the US on a collision course with China. Pelosi's possible visit is "purely provocative", Kremlin spokesperson Dmitry Peskov added. China has said its military won't "sit idly by" if Pelosi visits Taiwan, which Beijing considers its own territory.

32.title: I-T Dept reduces time for ITR verification to 30 days from 120 days
32.article_body: The Income Tax Department has reduced the time limit for e-verification or hard copy submission of the ITR-V. From August 1 onwards, the time limit for e-verification or submission of ITR-V will be 30 days instead of the earlier 120 days. E-verification of an ITR completes the return filing process, failing which, an ITR is treated as invalid.

33.title: Full schedule for Asia Cup cricket 2022 released, India to face Pakistan on August 28
33.article_body: The entire schedule for Asia Cup 2022 has been released. India and Pakistan have been placed in the same group. India will kick off their campaign with a match against Pakistan on August 28 in Dubai. Meanwhile, Sri Lanka will face Afghanistan in the tournament opener on August 27 in Dubai. The final will be held on September 11.

34.title: They have got a 'few challenges': Glenn McGrath on the future of ODIs
34.article_body: Former Australian pacer Glenn McGrath said he believes that ODI cricket will remain exciting as long as runs are being scored, adding that it will be interesting to see the future of ODIs. "They have got a few challenges," he stated. Ex-Pakistan captain Wasim Akram had recently said that ODI cricket is dying and administrators should consider scrapping the format.

35.title: 6 Indian startups selected for South Korean accelerator programme
35.article_body: The K-Startup Grand Challenge 2022 is the world's largest accelerator programme for which six Indian startups have been selected. An initiative of the South Korean Ministry of SMEs and Startups and the National IT Industry Promotion Agency, the programme received over 2,600 applications from 122 countries. Through this initiative, the selected startups can expand their business into South Korea.

36.title: Was offered ₹25 cr to vote for one candidate in Rajya Sabha poll: Rajasthan minister
36.article_body: Rajasthan Minister Rajendra Gudha has alleged that he was offered ₹25 crore if he voted for a particular person in the recently held Rajya Sabha election. He said he asked his wife who told him that they would rather have goodwill. "When the political crisis [in Rajasthan] was going on, I had an offer of ₹60 crore," he added.

37.title: Shraddha to star opposite Kartik Aaryan in 'Tezaab' remake: Report
37.article_body: Actress Shraddha Kapoor has reportedly been approached to star opposite Kartik Aaryan in the remake of 1988 film 'Tezaab'. "Shraddha and Kartik haven't shared onscreen space together so far and if things work out, this is a pair [makers] would like to bet on," India Today quoted a source as saying. The original film starred Madhuri Dixit and Anil Kapoor.

38.title: Pitch was playing nicely, we didn't apply ourselves: Rohit on 2nd T20I loss
38.article_body: After India's five-wicket loss against West Indies in second T20I, India skipper Rohit Sharma said his side didn't bat well in Basseterre. "The pitch was playing nicely but we didn't apply ourselves. But this can happen. When you're doing something as a batting group, you might not always succeed," he added. India were bowled out for 138 in 19.4 overs.

39.title: J'khand schools not notified as Urdu schools told to remove 'Urdu' from name
39.article_body: Jharkhand government's primary education department has issued an order asking schools which have not been notified as Urdu schools to remove 'Urdu' word from their names. The order stated that such un-notified schools should also have a weekly off on Sunday. Moreover, the order also said that morning prayers in these un-notified schools will be kept like in the past.

40.title: Tabu cried thinking I am 'really dead': JD on his death scene in Satya
40.article_body: Discussing a scene depicting his character's death in 'Satya', actor JD Chakravarthy said he was asked not to show the film to his mother as the scene is very real and no mother can see her son dying. JD added that director Ram Gopal Varma told him actress Tabu started crying after watching the film, thinking he was "really dead".

41.title: E-commerce platform Combonation raises $2 mn in pre-seed funding
41.article_body: E-commerce platform Combonation secured a pre-seed funding of $2 million in the latest funding round from undisclosed private investors. The company aims to use funds to expand in technology and manpower. Combonation is looking to open over 50 offline retail stores across Delhi-NCR and has established a plan to expand to more than 100 locations in North India.

42.title: BMC to start door-to-door screening for cancer & diabetes in Mumbai
42.article_body: Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) is planning to start door-to-door screening and hospital examinations for cancer and diabetes from August 15. "Although we are starting with hypertension, the goal is to test Mumbaikars for...diabetes, common malignancies and mental health issues," a BMC officer said. "The scaling up of the programme will take time," she added.

43.title: Private entities can use drones for delivery purposes: Govt
43.article_body: Minister of State for Civil Aviation VK Singh told the Rajya Sabha that government would have no objection if private players use drones for delivery purposes. The response mentioned that the government used drones to deliver vaccines to remote regions during the pandemic. More than 100 Industrial Training Institutes will be opened to teach five courses in drone technology.

44.title: 4 BJP MLAs suspended from Jharkhand Assembly for 'unruly' behaviour
44.article_body: Jharkhand Assembly Speaker Rabindra Nath Mahato on Tuesday suspended four BJP MLAs from the House till August 4. Bhanu Pratap Shahi, Dhullu Mahto, Jai Prakash Bhai Patel and Randhir Singh were suspended for alleged unruly behaviour. This came after a commotion was created in the House as BJP members sought CM Hemant Soren's resignation and demanded a debate on corruption.

45.title: Delhi govt to start 'Doctor on Wheels' scheme for construction workers
45.article_body: Delhi government on Monday announced 'Doctor on Wheels' scheme for construction workers under which they will be offered routine health check-ups. As per the official statement, the government will also launch unique 'mobile creches' for children of these workers at sites, where they will get better day-care facilities. The Delhi government is running 17 welfare schemes for construction workers.

46.title: Reserve Bank of Australia hikes rate to 6-year high of 1.85%
46.article_body: In a first, the Reserve Bank of Australia (RBA) on Tuesday hiked its benchmark interest rate for four months in a row by 0.5% points to a six-year high of 1.85%. RBA Governor Philip Lowe said the increase in interest rates was because of the "high priority" to return inflation to the 2-3% range over time.

47.title: Priyanka Chopra breaks down as she meets Ukrainian refugees, shares video
47.article_body: Priyanka Chopra, who is on a visit to Poland to meet Ukrainian refugees, shared a video of her interaction with the women and children, who were forced to leave their homes. One clip shows the children giving her handmade dolls and another clip shows her breaking down on hearing the refugees' stories. Priyanka is a global goodwill ambassador with UNICEF.

48.title: Weightlifter Punam Yadav misses out on CWG medal after 3 failed clean & jerk attempts
48.article_body: Indian weightlifter Punam Yadav missed out on a medal at CWG 2022 after three failed clean and jerk attempts during her women's 76-kg event. Punam, who bagged gold medal at CWG 2018 and a bronze medal at CWG 2014, had lifted 98 kg in snatch. She failed to successfully lift 116 kg in all of her clean and jerk attempts.

49.title: I fight mindsets: Kangana on Karan Johar's 'Hindi downmarket' remark
49.article_body: Reacting to filmmaker Karan Johar sharing in his biography that he considered Hindi as "downmarket", actress Kangana Ranaut wrote on Instagram, "I don't fight individuals, I fight mindsets." "To a large extent, I've fought this prejudice against small Hindi-speaking people," added Kangana. Karan Johar had shared in his biography that he didn't like producer Aditya Chopra as he spoke Hindi.

50.title: N Korean hackers faking resumes to get jobs at US crypto firms: Report
50.article_body: North Korean hackers are reportedly browsing job sites like LinkedIn and Indeed and stealing information from legitimate profiles to build plagiarised resumes to get jobs at US cryptocurrency firms. A report said that the hackers are securing employment at these companies in order to raise funds for the North Korean government.

51.title: 81 Chinese nationals given 'Leave India' notice during 2019-21: Govt
51.article_body: The Lok Sabha was informed on Tuesday that 81 Chinese nationals were given 'Leave India' notice while 117 others from that country were deported for violating visa conditions and other illegal acts during 2019 to 2021. As many as 726 Chinese nationals were placed in 'adverse list' for violating visa conditions and other illegal acts, Union Minister Nityanand Rai said.

52.title: Oommen Chandy becomes longest serving MLA in Kerala Assembly
52.article_body: Congress leader and ex-Kerala CM Oommen Chandy became the longest serving MLA in the state Assembly by completing 51 years and over three months. He broke the existing record in the name of former Kerala Congress (M) supremo late KM Mani. Chandy represented only Puthuppally in the past five decades. He became the MLA at the age of 27.

53.title: SC seeks govt's response on pleas over CBI, ED chiefs' tenure extension
53.article_body: SC on Tuesday sought the Centre's response on the petitions challenging the ordinances passed in November 2021 for the extension of the tenure of CBI & ED chiefs by up to five years. The petitions allege that amendments were brought to extend the tenure of ED director Sanjay Kumar Mishra. CJI NV Ramana is heading the bench hearing the pleas.

54.title: Govt to fill over 84,000 vacancies in armed forces by Dec 2023: MoS Rai
54.article_body: The central government has decided to fill up existing vacancies in the armed forces by December 2023, MoS for Home Affairs Nityanand Rai said on Tuesday. He informed that there were a total of 84,659 vacancies in the Central Armed Police Forces (CAPFs) and Assam Rifles till July 31, 2022. Of these, the maximum (27,510) were in CRPF, he added.

55.title: Monekypox isn't a new disease, don't panic: Union Health Minister
55.article_body: Amid a rise in monkeypox cases, Union Health Minister Mansukh Mandaviya on Tuesday advised people to not panic and said that the awareness programmes are being run in collaboration with state governments. "When cases started appearing in...world, India had already started preparations," he added. Furthermore, he said that monkeypox "isn't a new disease" in India and in the world.

56.title: Gold prices marginally down in India, hit 4-week high globally
56.article_body: Gold prices in India were trading marginally lower on Tuesday with gold October futures down by ₹96 at ₹51,530 per 10 gram at the Multi Commodity Exchange. Silver September futures fell ₹256 to ₹58,070 per kg. Meanwhile, gold hit a four-week high globally as a weaker dollar and a dip in US Treasury yields bolstered its demand.

57.title: 3-year-old twins joined at the brain separated using virtual reality in Brazil
57.article_body: A pair of twins who were conjoined at the head have been successfully separated with the help of virtual reality in Brazil. The three-year-old boys underwent seven surgeries, involving over 27 hours of operating time in the final operation alone, and almost 100 medical staff. They are now able to look at each other for the first time.

58.title: Manpreet Kaur qualifies for women's shot put final at CWG 2022
58.article_body: Manpreet Kaur has qualified for the women's shot put final at the Commonwealth Games 2022. Kaur qualified with a throw of 16.78m and was ranked seventh overall in the qualifying rounds. Jamaica's Danniel Thomas-Dodd topped the qualifying rounds with a throw of 18.42m. The automatic qualifying mark was 18m in the event.

59.title: BJP's eyes blindfolded with ego; can't see rising inflation: Rahul
59.article_body: Congress MP Rahul Gandhi has criticised the BJP-led Centre for rising inflation by sharing a chart of increases in prices of eight basic commodities. "BJP went on to claim in the Parliament that there is no inflation in India. Anyways, how will they see rising inflation? Their eyes are blindfolded with ego," Rahul tweeted.

60.title: PMC approves ₹6.24 crore for machine cleaning of public toilets
60.article_body: Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) has approved ₹6.24 crore for the cleaning of public and community toilets via jetting machines. "PMC used to clean public toilets manually. Following complaints over cleanliness, the civic body has decided to use jetting machines...Zonal officers will float tender, hire agency and handle the project," PMC's Solid Waste Management Department head Asha Raut said.

61.title: Actor Prabhas has weird purity in his eyes: Actress Kriti Sanon
61.article_body: Actress Kriti Sanon has said she would "love" to work with her 'Adipurush' co-star Prabhas again. "He has some weird purity in his eyes...he is one of those people whose eyes are really expressive and very deep and there is something very pure," she added. Filmmaker Om Raut is the director of 'Adipurush'.

62.title: Anupam Kher joins cast of Ravi Teja-starrer 'Tiger Nageswara Rao'
62.article_body: Actor Anupam Kher announced on Monday that he has joined the cast of actor Ravi Teja's upcoming film 'Tiger Nageswara Rao'. "My 528th film is Telugu one with great talent in every department," Kher wrote on Instagram while sharing his look from the film. The film is based on a notorious thief and is set in Andhra Pradesh's Stuartpuram village.

63.title: 'Jee Le Zaraa' is happening, will go on floors next year: Alia Bhatt
63.article_body: Alia Bhatt has said that 'Jee Le Zaraa' is happening and will go on the floors next year. The film will also feature Priyanka Chopra and Katrina Kaif. "Of course, we cannot go on the floor this year. We ain't letting that film go. We are fighting for it and we are all too excited about it," the actress added.

64.title: US to send $550 million worth of new weapons to Ukraine
64.article_body: The US has announced an additional $550 million in military aid to Ukraine.  The new package will include more ammunition for the High Mobility Artillery Rocket Systems (HIMARS) and 75,000 rounds of 155mm artillery ammunition, US Defence Department said. "We remain committed to providing Ukraine with the capabilities they need to defend their homeland," US Defence Secretary Lloyd Austin said.

65.title: Woman throws slipper at Partha Chatterjee while being taken to ED office
65.article_body: A woman threw a slipper at former Bengal minister Partha Chatterjee today while he was being taken to the ED office from central government-run hospital near Kolkata. "I had come to throw my slipper on him. He has taken money from poor people. I would have been happier if the slipper would have hit him on his head," she said.

66.title: UK PM candidate Truss to scrap plans to restrict junk food deals
66.article_body: Liz Truss, the leading contender to become UK's next PM, said she will scrap plans to restrict multi-buy deals on unhealthy foods. In an interview, Truss said Britons don't want the government telling them what to eat. In May, UK delayed plans to ban 'buy one get one free' offers on junk food due to cost-of-living crisis.

67.title: Mahua Moitra releases pics with '₹1.5 lakh bag' amid criticism she hid it in Parliament
67.article_body: TMC leader Mahua Moitra has shared photos showing her with her bag on different occasions in the Parliament complex. This comes after she was criticised for allegedly trying to hide the bag, which reports claimed was priced over ₹1.5 lakh, during a debate on inflation. She tweeted, "Jholewala fakir in Parliament since 2019. Jhola leke aye the...jhola leke chal padenge..."

68.title: Karan Johar knows cinema, understands dynamics of filmmaking minutely: Azmi
68.article_body: Actress Shabana Azmi, speaking about her experience while filming for 'Rocky Aur Rani Ki Prem Kahani', has said that she was amazed at filmmaker Karan Johar's understanding of the craft. Karan is the director of the film. "Karan is a director who knows cinema and understands the dynamics and nuances of filmmaking minutely," she further added.

69.title: Bajaj Auto two-wheeler sales drop by 5% in July to 3.15 lakh units
69.article_body: Bajaj Auto on Monday reported a 5% fall in its total two-wheeler sales at 3,15,054 units in July 2022 as against 3,30,569 units in the corresponding period last year. While domestic two-wheeler sales rose by 5% to 1,64,384 units, exports fell by 14%. The commercial vehicle sales rose by 3% with 39,616 units sold against 38,547 units in July 2021.

70.title: Pelosi's Taiwan visit will undermine US-China relations: China
70.article_body: Chinese Ambassador to UN, Zhang Jun, has said that US House Speaker Nancy Pelosi's Taiwan visit would undermine the relationship between China and the US. "Such a visit is apparently very much dangerous and provocative," Zhang said during a news conference. Zhang also urged Washington to honour the one-China principle. US said it will not be intimidated by China's warnings.

71.title: SpiceJet clears all pending dues with Airports Authority of India
71.article_body: SpiceJet entered into an agreement with the Airports Authority of India (AAI) and cleared all outstanding principal dues of the airport operator. In 2020, the AAI had put SpiceJet on a ‘cash and carry’ basis for the failure to clear its previous dues. Under this model, an airline has to make payments to the AAI for various charges every day.

72.title: Had to play dad to 20-year-old, I thought 'F*** you': Colin on 1st older role
72.article_body: Actor Colin Farrell said that he almost took offence when he was offered his first older role. "I do remember first time I got script where I was playing father of someone who was 20 and I thought, 'F*** you'. I realised it was an absolutely inappropriate offer to make," he said, adding that he's having fun in his 40s.

73.title: Nigerian national in Delhi tests positive for monkeypox, 3rd case in national capital
73.article_body: Delhi on Tuesday reported its third confirmed case of monkeypox. This comes after a 31-year-old man from Nigeria, admitted to the Lok Nayak Hospital, tested positive for the virus. "India currently has eight confirmed cases of monkeypox. Out of the eight patients, five have a history of foreign travel," Union Health Minister Mansukh Mandaviya on Tuesday said.

74.title: 6 Army jawans booked in Raj after man admitted by them to hospital dies
74.article_body: An FIR has been registered against six Army jawans in Rajasthan after a 24-year-old man whom they had admitted to a hospital in Pokhran died, police said. The man and his friend had gone to the prohibited firing range in Pokhran on a motorcycle. The man's family claimed that he was caught by the jawans who thrashed him badly.

75.title: Wanted younger actress for Kareena's role, would've been mistake: Aamir on 'Laal...'
75.article_body: Actor Aamir Khan has stated that the team was originally looking for a younger actress for Kareena Kapoor's role in 'Laal Singh Chaddha'. "That was a mistake we were making," he added. Aamir said they were looking at a video of another actor and accidentally saw Kareena in it. "Since she wasn't 25, we didn't think of her," he said.

76.title: Any experimentation should be avoided: Rajkumar on Suryakumar opening
76.article_body: Reacting to batter Suryakumar Yadav opening the innings in the T20I series against West Indies, Virat Kohli's childhood coach Rajkumar Sharma said, "This is a huge experiment." "Any experimentation involving him should be avoided," added Rajkumar. Discussing the decision to send Suryakumar as an opener, ex-India batter Kris Srikkanth stated, "Please don't do that...Don't spoil the cricketer."

77.title: NMMT introduces buses for Bhiwandi from Navi Mumbai's Airoli
77.article_body: The Navi Mumbai Municipal Transport (NMMT) has introduced a new bus route to Thane's Bhiwandi from Airoli in Navi Mumbai. The bus service started on Monday (August 1) and frequency of the service is 25 to 30 minutes, as per reports. The places that come in the new route are Airoli, Thane, Majiwada, Bhiwandi Bypass and Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj Chowk.

78.title: Oppo, Vivo India & Xiaomi served notices for alleged tax evasion: Sitharaman
78.article_body: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman informed Rajya Sabha that three Chinese mobile companies- Oppo, Vivo India and Xiaomi have been served notices for alleged tax evasion by them. She said, while Oppo has been sent a notice for total customs duty of ₹4,389 crore, three show-cause notices have been issued to Xiaomi for an approximate duty liability of about ₹653 crore.

79.title: I sacrificed stardom to get freedom to cater to audience I wanted: Abhay
79.article_body: Actor Abhay Deol has stated that he had to sacrifice his stardom to be allowed the freedom to cater to the audience he wanted. He said that he was told to take advantage of the image of the Deol family. "Even though I did the films I did, it's difficult to...be constantly pushing because...filmmaking is a collective process," Abhay added.

80.title: Disappointing to lose film to A-lister who didn't even audition: Harleen
80.article_body: Actress Harleen Sethi stated that it's disappointing to lose a Bollywood film to an A-lister after being locked for six months. "I...get messages from directors saying, 'It was the best audition and you were the closest'," she said. The actress added that it happened recently when an A-lister got her part without even giving an audition or a look test.

81.title: Telecom sector may see ₹2-3 trillion investment in next 2 yrs: Vaishnaw
81.article_body: Communications Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw said India's telecom industry is likely to see investment of ₹2-3 trillion in next two years as reforms by the government have removed uncertainty and risks. "It's going to be significant investment by the industry," he said. Vaishnaw added that he's sure that the trend of affordable services will continue as operators start launching 5G services.

82.title: 99% of Florida's turtles born female due to hotter summers: Study
82.article_body: According to study, 99% of turtles born in Florida in the past four years have turned out to be female, thanks to hotter summers. According to researchers, the sex of sea turtles depends on temperature of developing eggs. If a turtle's egg is incubated below 27.7°C, the hatchling will be male, but if it's incubated above 31°C, it'll be female.

83.title: 2 held for theft of diamonds worth ₹3.5 cr in Mumbai, 1 absconding
83.article_body: The Mumbai Police have arrested two diamond brokers, Bharat Kandol and Amrut Bhai Patel, in connection with the theft of diamonds worth ₹3.5 crore, an official said on Monday. The mastermind behind the crime, Kaushik Chovatila, is absconding, the official added. The accused allegedly contacted a diamond merchant, expressing interest in purchasing diamonds, after which they stole the stones.

84.title: 76-yr-old rapes minor by luring her with ₹10 in Chhattisgarh, held
84.article_body: Two men, including a 76-year-old, were arrested for allegedly raping a 13-year-old girl multiple times by luring her with ₹10 in Chhattisgarh, police said on Tuesday. The incident came to light when a woman from the victim's neighbourhood saw her coming out of the houses of the two accused and informed her parents, Balodabazar kotwali SHO Yadumani Sidar said.

85.title: Muhammed Yahiya, Sreeshankar qualify for men's long jump final at CWG 2022
85.article_body: India's Muhammed Anees Yahiya and Sreeshankar Murali have qualified for the men's long jump final at CWG 2022. Sreeshankar topped the qualifying rounds with an 8.05m jump to advance to the final, while Anees Yahiya produced an effort of 7.68m to be ranked eighth overall. Notably, Sreeshankar was the only one to cross the 8m automatic qualifying mark.

86.title: Multi-million dollars worth of crypto stolen from crypto firm Nomad's 'bridge'
86.article_body: US crypto firm Nomad's 'bridge', a tool which allows users to transfer tokens between blockchains, has been hit with a multi-million dollar theft. According to blockchain researchers, $150-$190 million worth of users' cryptocurrencies, including ether and USDC, were stolen. Nomad tweeted that it was "aware of the incident" and was currently investigating it but didn't disclose the theft's value.

87.title: Disappointed with govt: Family of BSF constable killed in Congo
87.article_body: The family of the BSF head constable Shishupal Singh Bagadia, who was killed in Congo, has said that they are "disappointed" with the Rajasthan government as nobody shared proper information. "No one reached out... We know how we spent the last six-seven days, how difficult it was," Bagadia's wife Kamla Devi said in presence of PCC chief Govind Dotasra.

88.title: 3 rob food delivery executive of his scooter in Delhi, arrested
88.article_body: Three men were arrested for allegedly robbing a scooter from a food delivery executive in Delhi's Subhash Place area, police said on Tuesday. The complainant said that the accused tried to steal his phone and attacked him with a sharp object when he resisted. The accused escaped with his scooter when he fell down, the complainant added.

89.title: Drugs worth ₹15 cr seized in Assam's Karbi Anglong, 3 arrested
89.article_body: Police said three persons were arrested on Tuesday and different types of drugs worth ₹15 crore were seized from them in Assam's Karbi Anglong district. According to a senior police official, the accused were heading towards West Bengal's Siliguri from Manipur. The seizures include 380 gm of heroin, one kg of morphine and two kg of methamphetamine, the official added.

90.title: Slain al-Qaeda chief Zawahiri penned a poem for Karnataka girl over hijab issue
90.article_body: Al-Qaeda chief Ayman al-Zawahiri, who was killed in a US drone strike in Kabul on Sunday, had recently released a video in which he spoke on the issue of hijab in Karnataka's educational institutions. He also penned a poem praising Muskan Khan, the girl who gained popularity for confronting a group of boys who were opposed to girls wearing hijab.

91.title: India to extend extra $100 mn line of credit to Maldives: PM Modi
91.article_body: After a meeting with Maldives' President Ibrahim Mohamed Solih in New Delhi on Tuesday, PM Narendra Modi said that India will extend an additional $100 million line of credit to the island nation. "In the last few years, there has been a renewed vigor in the friendly relations between India and Maldives, our closeness has increased," PM Modi tweeted.

92.title: US deploys 4 warships near Taiwan amid Chinese warnings over House Speaker's visit
92.article_body: Four US Navy warships have been positioned in waters east of Taiwan amid repeated Chinese warnings over House Speaker Nancy Pelosi's imminent visit to the island nation. An aircraft carrier is among the four vessels that have been deployed in the Philippines Sea, a US Navy official confirmed to Reuters. The official, however, said these were "routine deployments".

93.title: Nation is proud of your achievement: Harbhajan on Shushila's CWG 2022 silver
93.article_body: Harbhajan Singh took to Twitter to congratulate judoka Shushila Devi for winning silver medal at the Commonwealth Games (CWG) 2022 on Monday and wrote, "Nation is proud of your achievement in Birmingham. Keep it up." Gautam Gambhir tweeted, "Exceptional performance Shushila Devi...congratulations India on the silver medal!" Shushila won silver in the women's 48 kg final.

94.title: Europe’s ‘last known’ giant panda species discovered in Bulgaria
94.article_body: A new species of giant panda believed to be the "last known" and "most evolved" of its kind in Europe has been discovered in the wetlands of Bulgaria. "Although not a direct ancestor of the modern...giant panda, it is its close relative," a researcher said. The species that lived six million years ago likely fed on softer plant materials.

95.title: Average time taken to probe a rape case reduced to 57 days in Rajasthan: Police
95.article_body: The average time taken to probe a rape case in Rajasthan has reduced to 57 days as of June 2022, a police spokesperson said. The average time taken to probe a rape case was 435 days in 2017. It reduced to 211 days in 2018, 140 days in 2019, 117 days in 2020 and 86 days in 2021, spokesperson added.

96.title: 20 historical sites identified for 'national importance tag': Centre
96.article_body: At least 20 heritage and religious sites have been identified for the 'national importance tag', Centre said. They include the two ancient mounds at Haryana's Rakhigarhi, rock painting at Chintakunta in Andhra Pradesh and Kaleshwar Mahadev Temple in Himachal Pradesh. Notably, the Rakhigarhi site is one of the "five iconic sites", which was declared by Centre in Union Budget 2020-21.

97.title: Armed man arrested near TRS MLA Jeevan Reddy's house in Hyderabad
97.article_body: A person moving with a firearm near the house of Hyderabad MLA Jeevan Reddy has been arrested. The man has been identified as Prasad Goud, the husband of a village sarpanch who was recently suspended from the TRS. He was moving under suspicious circumstances in Vemuri Enclave and a gun and a knife were recovered from him.

98.title: Man chops off policeman's lips, ears, nose for having affair with his wife in Pakistan
98.article_body: A policeman's nose, ears and lips were chopped off by a man who accused him of blackmailing his wife and forcing her to have illicit relations with him, police in Pakistan's Punjab province said. "Iftikhar, who suspected Hayat (policeman) of having relations with his wife, in connivance with 12 accomplices abducted him on his way back home," police stated.

99.title: Shot with Aamir when I was over 5 months pregnant: Kareena on ageism
99.article_body: Actress Kareena Kapoor Khan, speaking about ageism in Bollywood, said, "Age is just a number...people are doing different characters...you're as old as you look." Kareena added she was five and a half months pregnant when she shot with Aamir Khan for 'Laal Singh Chaddha'. "So, it's up to the person to break boundaries and take up the challenge," she stated.

100.title: Kareena possibly wasn't keen on working with new director: Onir on Chameli
100.article_body: Filmmaker Onir said that film producer Rangita Nandy offered him to direct 'Chameli' after filmmaker Anant Balani died of a heart attack. "I half-heartedly agreed and was kind of relieved when things didn't work out, possibly because Kareena (Kapoor) was not keen on working with a new director," Onir wrote in his book.

101.title: Entire TMC a thief: WB BJP president on Partha, Arpita arrests
101.article_body: West Bengal BJP president Sukanta Majumdar said that the entire Trinamool Congress (TMC) is a "thief". "TMC has been lying from the very beginning, Arpita Mukherjee is a political personality...she used to be part of Partha Chatterjee's political campaigns and other programmes of TMC," Majumdar alleged. This comes after a huge amount of cash was seized from Mukherjee's flats.

102.title: Australian Senator calls Queen Elizabeth a 'coloniser' while taking oath
102.article_body: Australian Senator, Lidia Thorpe, referred to Queen Elizabeth II as a "coloniser" while being sworn into Australia's Parliament. The Indigenous senator was forced to redo the oath of allegiance after the Senate President interjected. The 96-year-old British monarch is also Australia's head of state. After reciting the pledge as required, Thorpe took to Twitter and said, "Sovereignty never ceded."

103.title: Mark Rutte becomes Netherlands' longest-serving Prime Minister
103.article_body: Mark Rutte on Tuesday became the Netherlands' longest-serving Prime Minister. Rutte has been in charge for 4,311 days, since he first became PM in October 2010, a day longer than Ruud Lubbers who led the Netherlands in the 1980s and early '90s. The 55-year-old is the second longest-serving elected leader in the 27-nation European Union, trailing only Hungary's Viktor Orban.

104.title: Former beauty queen Sarah Davies lifts 229 kg to win weightlifting gold at CWG 2022
104.article_body: Former beauty queen-turned-weightlifter Sarah Davies, who had won Miss Leeds and Miss Intercontinental England titles, bagged a gold medal in women's weightlifting at CWG 2022. She lifted a total of 229 kg, with 103 kg in snatch and 126 kg in clean and jerk to win the women's 71-kg category. Sarah had won silver at CWG 2018 in Gold Coast.

105.title: Jan 6 rioter who took gun to US Capitol & threatened Nancy Pelosi jailed for 7 years
105.article_body: A federal judge on Monday sentenced Guy Reffitt, who brought a gun to the US Capitol during the January 6, 2021 riot and threatened House Speaker Nancy Pelosi, to over seven years in prison, the longest Capitol riot-related sentence to date. "Mr Reffitt's reluctance to admit early that his behavior is illegal is concerning," District Judge Dabney Friedrich said.

106.title: Naga minister takes part in traditional dance, says 'I can dance too'
106.article_body: Nagaland minister Temjen Imna Along took to Twitter to share a video of himself participating in a traditional dance. "See, I can dance too!" Along tweeted. The BJP MLA said the video was from Tsungremong, a festival of the Ao Nagas celebrated for invoking blessing of a bountiful harvest. Along also invited people to visit Nagaland to explore its culture.

107.title: 21-year-old man charged under NSA for setting fire to UP hospital
107.article_body: A 21-year-old man has been charged under National Security Act (NSA) for allegedly setting fire to a portion of a hospital building in Uttar Pradesh's Sambhal district on June 28. The accused, identified as Raja Ansari, was arrested in July, police said. Earlier, it was reported that Ansari committed the crime after being denied free medicine by the hospital's staff.

108.title: If his favourite book falls, I know he's around somewhere: Sutapa on Irrfan
108.article_body: Writer Sutapa Sikdar, wife of late actor Irrfan Khan, in an interview said, "Even though he's gone, I know he's around." "Especially at nights, if it's raining, or his favourite book falls, I know he's around somewhere," she added. Sutapa further said they often slept in different rooms as Irrfan was a night person and she was a day person.

109.title: Exclusionary to vegetarians: BJP leader as K’taka plans eggs for midday meals
109.article_body: BJP leader Tejaswini Ananth Kumar on Tuesday asked why has the Karnataka government decided to give eggs to students in midday meals. "These are not the only source of nutrition. It’s also exclusionary to many students who are vegetarians," she tweeted. "Our policies are to be designed such that every student has equal opportunity," she added.

110.title: Suspecting infidelity, man slits wife's throat in front of landlord in Punjab
110.article_body: A 25-year-old man was arrested for allegedly killing his 35-year-old wife by slitting her throat in front of their landlord in Punjab's Ludhiana. The accused's wife used to work as a beautician and visited clients' homes. The accused used to stop her from going out and suspected her of infidelity, police said.

111.title: Modified 'Laal...' based on reaction by Rajamouli, Nagarjuna: Aamir
111.article_body: Actor Aamir Khan said he made a change in his film 'Laal Singh Chaddha' based on the reactions of 'RRR' director SS Rajamouli, 'Pushpa: The Rise' director Sukumar and actors Nagarjuna and Chiranjeevi. "The change was very correct," he added. Aamir organised a special screening of 'Laal Singh Chaddha' for them, following which Chiranjeevi hugged Aamir who was in tears.

112.title: There is no good, bad Taliban; will never support terrorism: Digvijaya
112.article_body: Former Madhya Pradesh CM and Congress MP Digvijaya Singh has said that he commends the elimination of Al Qaeda's chief Ayman al- Zawahiri. "There is no Good Taliban and Bad Taliban," Singh said. He added, "My BJP-Sanghi friends have an illness of speaking lies. I will never support terrorism...irrespective of which country or religion they belong to."

113.title: Corruption charges against Opposition leaders based on evidence: BJP
113.article_body: BJP on Tuesday refuted indulging in vendetta politics, saying charges of corruption against Opposition leaders are based on evidence and facts, not rhetoric. "The Opposition shouldn't politicise corruption," BJP spokesperson Sambit Patra said. He added BJP will never interfere in the work of investigation agencies. This comes after Sena MP Sanjay Raut was arrested by ED in Patra Chawl scam.

114.title: Man dies after falling into cauldron of porridge at temple in TN's Madurai
114.article_body: A man reportedly died of burn injuries after he fell into a cauldron of porridge at Muthu Mariyammam temple in Tamil Nadu's Madurai. The man, Muthukumar, fainted and lost his balance before falling into the cauldron, a CCTV footage of the incident showed. People pulled Muthukumar out of the cauldron and rushed him to a nearby hospital.

115.title: 6 more held in K'taka in Fazil murder case; police say 'attack pre-planned'
115.article_body: Police in Karnataka's Mangaluru have arrested six more persons in connection with the murder of 23-year-old Fazil in the Surathkal area on July 28. According to police, the attack was pre-planned and the accused had been observing Fazil for a few days before attacking him. So far, around 51 people have been questioned in this connection, police added.

116.title: Mumbai-Nagpur expressway's first phase likely to be inaugurated on Aug 15
116.article_body: Mumbai-Nagpur expressway's first phase, a 480 km stretch between Shirdi and Nagpur, has been completed and is intended to be inaugurated on August 15, said Radheshyam Mopalwar, MD of Maharashtra State Road Development Corporation. "We're planning to complete the entire 700-km stretch by end of May 2023," he said. "Toll collection systems, petrol pumps, everything is ready," he added.

117.title: Vehicle carrying Central Vista workers hits bus in Delhi; 28 hospitalised
117.article_body: As many as 28 people were taken to a hospital after a private vehicle, in which labourers from the Central Vista project were travelling, hit a cluster bus from behind in Delhi's Ranjeet Nagar on Tuesday, police said. The private vehicle's driver suffered severe injuries, police added. Of those injured, three people were from the cluster bus, police further added.

118.title: BMTC introduces new bus route between Silk Institute metro and airport
118.article_body: The Bengaluru Metropolitan Transport Corporation (BMTC) has added a new Vayuvajra bus route called 'KIA-5D' connecting commuters from the Silk Institute metro station to Kempegowda International Airport (KIA). This route takes commuters from Silk Institute to Bengaluru airport through the Konanakunte Cross, Banashankari, Jayanagara 4th Block, Shanthinagara TTMC, RM Guttahalli and Hebbala.

119.title: You take 100-200 days to finish film, Akshay does in 30 days: Kareena to Aamir
119.article_body: In the promo of the upcoming episode of 'Koffee With Karan 7', actress Kareena Kapoor Khan can be seen telling actor Aamir Khan that he takes 100-200 days to finish a film while actor Akshay Kumar finishes one in 30 days. Her comment came in response to being asked what she tolerates in Aamir but wouldn't tolerate in others.

120.title: We were back in the game thanks to our bowlers: India bowling coach Mhambrey
120.article_body: India bowling coach Paras Mhambrey has said they have a lot of positives to take from their defeat in the second T20I against the West Indies. "We didn't have many runs...[but] we pretty much came [back] in the game thanks to our bowers," added Mhambrey. "I'm happy with the potential [young bowlers] have shown in [recent] games," he further said.

121.title: Kanpur school manager booked after students forced to recite 'Kalma'
121.article_body: The manager of Florets International School in Uttar Pradesh's Kanpur has been booked after students were allegedly forced to recite 'Kalma' during morning prayers. This comes after a student's father alleged that "seeds of conversion" were being sown in children at the school. "Now, only the National Anthem is being sung during morning prayers," Kanpur ACP Nishank Sharma said.

122.title: Mob storms into check post, attacks police & frees drug smuggler in Punjab
122.article_body: A group of people, including women, reportedly stormed into the Chawinda Devi police check post that falls under the jurisdiction of Amritsar Rural Police on Monday. They attacked four on-duty policemen and freed an alleged drug smuggler from their custody. The crowd claimed the man, who was caught with nine grams of heroin, wasn't a smuggler but a drug addict.

123.title: Johar, Pandya, KL Rahul found innocent by court over comments on women on 'Koffee...'
123.article_body: The Jodhpur High Court granted relief to cricketers Hardik Pandya and KL Rahul and director Karan Johar, in a case registered against the trio. It was registered for alleged offensive remarks on women made by the cricketers on 'Koffee with Karan' in 2018. According to reports, the court disposed of the case after they were found 'innocent'.

124.title: Outstanding accomplishment: PM as UPI transactions hit record 6 billion in July
124.article_body: PM Narendra Modi has lauded the "outstanding accomplishment" of record number of UPI transactions in July. About 6.28 billion UPI transactions worth over ₹10.62 lakh crore took place last month, the highest ever since UPI's inception in 2016. "It indicates the collective resolve of the people of India to embrace new technologies and make the economy cleaner," the PM said.

125.title: Unacademy suspends contracts of some educators, to cut doubt-solving: Report
125.article_body: Edtech unicorn Unacademy has suspended contracts of some of its doubt-solving NEET and IIT-JEE educators for a minimum of six months, Moneycontrol reported. In an email to educators, Unacademy said it will "significantly" reduce doubt solving on its platform. Last month, CEO Gaurav Munjal announced a slew of measures to cut costs, including pay cuts for founders and top management.

126.title: BharatPe Co-founder Bhavik Koladiya resigns months after Ashneer Grover's exit
126.article_body: BharatPe's Co-founder Bhavik Koladiya, who ran the product and technology operations for the company, has quit. While BharatPe said Koladiya wants to "spend time on other assignments outside" the firm, a report, while quoting sources, said that he resigned due to disagreements with CEO Suhail Sameer. His resignation comes months after the exit of BharatPe's other Co-founder Ashneer Grover.

127.title: I won't do any more projects if I do Bhansali's 'Heeramandi': Mumtaz
127.article_body: Veteran actress Mumtaz has said she would not do any more projects if she does filmmaker Sanjay Leela Bhansali's 'Heeramandi'. "Sanjay is the best filmmaker in India. I would love to work with him if I like my role [in 'Heeramandi']," she added. She further said that she does not have the "liberty" to discuss anything about the film.

128.title: Man stabs cousin 38 times over old dispute in Pune's Baramati; held
128.article_body: A 27-year-old barber was allegedly stabbed to death 38 times by his maternal cousin in a village near Baramati on Monday, Pune Rural Police said. The victim, Gajanan Pawar, was allegedly attacked by the accused, Santosh Gulmule, after an altercation broke out between them over an old dispute. Gulmule was arrested from a railway station while trying to escape.

129.title: Delhi HC quashes rape FIR, tells complainant to offer social service
129.article_body: The Delhi High Court has quashed a rape FIR by a woman complainant with a direction to her to offer social service at All India Confederation of the Blind for two months. The case was settled before the court hearing under which it stated that the parties had a money dispute. The accused has been directed to plant 50 trees.

130.title: Dhoni visits us, he said he plays lawn bowls in Australia: Lovely who reached CWG final
130.article_body: Lovely Choubey, who's a part of India's women's fours lawn bowls team that reached final at CWG 2022, said MS Dhoni knows a lot about their sport. She added he knows their coach and visits them in Ranchi. "We had a chat about the sport as well. He said...whenever he's in Australia he goes to play lawn bowls," Lovely said.

131.title: Taiwan starts 'preparing for war' with China
131.article_body: The Taiwanese Ministry of National Defense has begun to "immediately prepare for war" and has put the military on high alert, local news outlets reported. This comes amid repeated Chinese warnings of military action over the reported upcoming visit of US House Speaker Nancy Pelosi. Taiwan is reportedly preparing air-raid shelters for citizens and has cancelled soldiers' and officers' leaves.

132.title: Delhi HC quashes Arms Act FIR against man, tells him to give sanitisers to students
132.article_body: Delhi High Court quashed an FIR against a US resident who was found with a live bullet at the Indira Gandhi International Airport. The man had claimed that his uncle used a licensed weapon during celebratory firing at Diwali and a cartridge remained in his pocket. The court directed him to distribute mosquito repellents and hand sanitisers to school students.

133.title: 4 doctors, a manager booked for negligence after fire kills 8 at MP hospital
133.article_body: Four doctors and a manager were booked for negligence after a fire broke out at a private hospital in Madhya Pradesh's Jabalpur and killed eight people. The doctors are absconding, while the manager has been arrested, police said. "If government officials are found involved for giving permissions overlooking lapses, a case will be registered against them," SP Siddharth Bahuguna said.

134.title: Musk sued by Twitter investor with 5,500 shares over $44 bn buyout deal
134.article_body: A Twitter investor holding 5,500 shares has sued Tesla CEO Elon Musk with proposed class action and has named two "corporate acquisition entities" related to the deal as defendants apart from Musk. The shareholder seeks a court order compelling Musk to go through with his $44 billion deal. The new suit targets Musk's "lame rationales for reneging on his contract".

135.title: Twitter banned 43,140 Indian users in June for violating guidelines
135.article_body: Twitter banned 43,140 accounts of Indian users in June 2022 over violation of its guidelines, according to Twitter's July 2022 compliance report. Twitter removed 40,982 accounts for child sexual exploitation, non-consensual nudity and similar content, while 2,158 accounts were banned for promoting terrorism. Twitter's local grievance mechanism received 724 grievances between May 26 and June 25.

136.title: ED investigates GST number linked to Arpita Mukherjee
136.article_body: The Enforcement Directorate (ED) is investigating a GST number linked to former Bengal minister Partha Chatterjee’s close aide Arpita Mukherjee in connection to the SSC scam. "She used one GST number for running a beauty parlour business. We are trying to find out whether this one was generated in an illegal manner to evade taxes," an ED official said.

137.title: Cabinet rejig is to divert attention: BJP Bengal Chief
137.article_body: BJP Bengal chief Sukanta Majumdar on Monday took a potshot at CM Mamata Banerjee over Cabinet reshuffle. “Banerjee is taking such decisions to divert the media’s attention from the corruption cases,” said Majumdar while referring to the arrest of former Bengal minister Partha Chatterjee. Earlier, Mamata had announced to reshuffle the Cabinet.

138.title: CM Shinde cancels garden inauguration in Pune after controversy over name
138.article_body: Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde cancelled a garden inauguration programme in Pune after controversy erupted over reports that the garden was developed on public land and named after him. "We have cancelled the inauguration. We will put up a proposal with the name of the garden to Pune Municipal Corporation's garden committee for further decision," Shinde supporter Nana Bhangire said.

139.title: BJP, Cong workers clash in Tripura's Charilam; Section 144 imposed
139.article_body: CrPC Section 144 was imposed in Tripura's Charilam after a clash broke out between the workers of BJP and Congress. The police said that a group of BJP workers tried to provoke people during a political event organised by the Congress, after which they resorted to lathi charge. Meanwhile, Deputy CM Jishnu Dev Varma blamed the Congress for triggering violence.

140.title: Peacock wrapped in Tiranga after death in UP's Ghaziabad, video surfaces
140.article_body: A peacock was wrapped in Tiranga after it passed away in Uttar Pradesh's Ghaziabad. A video that surfaced online showed police personnel carrying the body of the peacock, wrapped in India's national flag, on a stretcher. According to reports, a Twitter user mentioned that the peacock was found dead at the Kaushambi metro station of the region.

141.title: Bengaluru likely to witness heavy rainfall today, tomorrow: IMD
141.article_body: The India Meteorological Department (IMD) has predicted that urban areas in Bengaluru are likely to witness heavy rainfall today and tomorrow. This comes after heavy showers in the city on Monday evening left several areas inundated. While power outages were reported in BTM and HSR Layout, water entered houses in Yelahanka, Yelachenahalli and some regions in north Bengaluru, reports said.

142.title: Biden says he's ready for nuclear deal with Russia as UN talks begin
142.article_body: US President Joe Biden said he is ready for new nuclear arms deal with Russia, calling upon Russian President Vladimir Putin to act in good faith. In a written statement to NPT review conference, Putin said that there will be no winners in a nuclear war. Putin had put nuclear arms on high alert days after Russian invasion of Ukraine.

143.title: Nuclear annihilation just one miscalculation away, warns UN chief
143.article_body: The world is "just one misunderstanding, one miscalculation away from nuclear annihilation", UN Secretary-General Antonio Guterres said while speaking at the opening of a Nuclear Non-proliferation Treaty conference. The conference is taking place "at a time of nuclear danger not seen since the height of the Cold War", he added, citing Russia-Ukraine war and "many other factors around the world".

144.title: Container truck carrying chemical overturns on Ghodbunder Road in Thane
144.article_body: A container truck transporting tanks of hydrogen peroxide chemical overturned on the busy Ghodbunder Road in Maharashtra's Thane on Tuesday. The gas from the container leaked on the road, emitting a foul odour. The accident resulted in a huge traffic jam, officials said. "There are no cases of anyone affected due to the chemical leak," an official said.

145.title: Has any BJP leader faced CBI, ED action: NCP youth wing poster in Aurangabad
145.article_body: Nationalist Congress Party's youth wing has put up banners in Maharashtra's Aurangabad, asking if any leader from the Bharatiya Janata Party has ever faced CBI or ED action. The poster that has NYC state secretary Akshay Patil's picture and contact details, also asked if any agency continued its probe against a leader after they switched over to the BJP.

146.title: 1.6 million coca leaf bushes seized in Honduras
146.article_body: Honduran authorities seized more than 1.6 million coca leaf bushes on Monday. Officials said that the bushes, used to make cocaine, were located in mountainous areas in the coastal department of Colon after a three-day operation. According to security forces statistics, total 2,625,015 bushes have been seized this year, significantly up from 531,826 bushes seized in 2021.

147.title: WI's Obed McCoy dedicates 'Man of the Match' award vs India to his mother
147.article_body: West Indies pacer Obed McCoy, who broke the record for best-ever T20I bowling figures against India in the second T20I on Monday, dedicated his 'Man of the Match' award to his mother. "She is sick and she has motivated me to be a better player," said McCoy at the post-match presentation. McCoy registered figures of 4-1-17-6 in the match.

148.title: Ex-K'taka minister's employee steals valuables from his B'luru home, arrested
148.article_body: The Bengaluru Police arrested an employee of former Karnataka Home Minister MB Patil for allegedly stealing foreign currency and valuables from his house in Bengaluru's Sadashivanagar. The accused, Jayanth Kumar, is a native of Odisha. Kumar used to work as a laundryman at Patil's home, police said, adding that he gifted the stolen watches to his friends in Odisha.

149.title: Goa CM urges citizens to join ‘Har Ghar Tiranga’ campaign
149.article_body: Ahead of the country's 75th Independence Day celebrations, Goa Chief Minister Pramod Sawant urged people to participate in the ‘Har Ghar Tiranga’ campaign and hoist the tricolour flag at their houses from August 13 to 16. “I urge Goans to keep the national flag as their display picture on social media from August 2 onwards,” Sawant said.

150.title: Polio was in NYC wastewater a month before case was detected: Official
150.article_body: New York health officials said that polio virus was present in wastewater of New York City suburb a month before health officials confirmed a case last month. In an emailed statement, US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) said there may be more people shedding the virus in their stool. Officials urged residents to be sure they are vaccinated.

151.title: Went wicketless after Murali wished me luck: Nilesh on 1997 Test vs SL
151.article_body: Recalling a Test match against Sri Lanka in 1997, ex-India spinner Nilesh Kulkarni said he got a wicket off his first ball in the match, but couldn't take a wicket in the game after that. "I'd met Muttiah Muralitharan...[after the day's play], he said '...Good luck for...next three days'. Little did I realise...I wouldn't pick a wicket," added Nilesh.

152.title: Storms hit Kentucky's flooded areas, curfews imposed due to looting
152.article_body: Disaster-hit areas in eastern Kentucky witnessed another round of storms on Monday. Death toll due to floods rose to 37 on Tuesday. According to Governor, rescue operations continue at a time when hundreds of people remain unaccounted for. Authorities declared county-wide nighttime curfews amidst looting reports in Breathitt County and Hindman in Knott County, which are devastated due to floods.

153.title: Go First car goes under IndiGo plane, narrowly avoiding collision at Delhi airport
153.article_body: A car belonging to Go First airline went under an IndiGo aircraft at Delhi airport on Tuesday, narrowly avoiding collision with the plane's nose wheel. The aircraft was readying to depart for Dhaka when the incident took place. A video of the incident has also surfaced on social media. According to officials, the DGCA will investigate the incident.

154.title: Whenever you do 'Koffee...' someone cries: Aamir Khan to Karan Johar
154.article_body: During his appearance on 'Koffee With Karan 7' which is hosted by filmmaker Karan Johar, actor Aamir Khan said, "Whenever you do your show, someone...cries." Aamir was accompanied by actress Kareena Kapoor. Responding to a question about the thing she tolerates about Aamir, Kareena stated him taking 100-200 days for shooting a film, which Akshay Kumar does in 30 days.

155.title: I really have to work on my phrasing: Brad Pitt on retirement claim
155.article_body: On being asked about his statement of being in the "last semester or trimester" of his career, actor Brad Pitt said that he really has to work on his phrasing. "I was just saying I'm past middle age and I want to be specific about how I spend those last things however they may be," the actor added.

156.title: Arshdeep has bowled tough overs for PBKS, that's why he was confident vs WI: Parthiv
156.article_body: Talking about pacer Arshdeep Singh, ex-India cricketer Parthiv Patel said the 23-year-old was "confident" in his bowling in the second T20I against West Indies on Monday. "Arshdeep has been bowling those tough overs [for PBKS], that's the reason why you could see the confidence in him," added Parthiv. Arshdeep registered figures of 1/26 off his four overs in the game.

157.title: DDA's cash deficit due to unsold housing inventory of ₹18,000 cr: Govt
157.article_body: Delhi Development Authority's cash deficit of ₹9,615 crore is primarily due to unsold housing inventory worth around ₹18,000 crore, Housing and Urban Affairs Minister of State, Kaushal Kishore, informed the Rajya Sabha. The housing stock is lying unsold since 2014 as small flats located in the Narela area are deemed to be too costly and lack Metro connectivity, Kishore stated.

158.title: 10 villa owners booked for illegal rentals in Pune's Lonavala
158.article_body: Pune's Lonavala police have booked 10 villa owners between July 29 and July 31 for allegedly illegally renting their properties to tourists. The city's municipal council also urged owners to not rent villas without checking safety measures. "Our drive has intensified after...two recent deaths. Owners should either get requisite licence or stop renting villas and bungalows," an inspector said.

159.title: Terrorists hurl grenade at police post in J&K's Ramban
159.article_body: Terrorists hurled a grenade at a police post in the Gool area of Jammu and Kashmir's Ramban district on Tuesday, said officials. The grenade exploded on the roof of the police post, however, no injuries were reported. Jammu Kashmir Ghaznavi Force (JKGF), an offshoot of Lashkar-e-Taiba, has claimed responsibility for the attack in a letter, said ADGP Mukesh Singh.

160.title: California declares state of emergency over monkeypox outbreak
160.article_body: California has declared a state of emergency due to the spread of monkeypox in a bid to escalate efforts to combat the outbreak. Emergency medical officials will be allowed to administer monkeypox vaccines approved by the federal government. Last week, the state expanded its testing capacity to carry out more than 1,000 tests a week.

161.title: Russian action at Ukraine's nuclear plant risks terrible accident: US
161.article_body: The US has accused Russia of using Ukraine's Zaporizhzhia nuclear power plant as a 'nuclear shield' and risking a terrible nuclear accident. US said that Russia has stationed troops near Zaporizhzhia plant, Ukraine's biggest nuclear power plant, and preventing Ukrainian forces from returning fire. In March, Russia was accused of firing shells dangerously close to the nuclear power plant.

162.title: US might control export of its chipmaking equipment to China: Report
162.article_body: US might limit shipment of American chipmaking equipment to Chinese memory chip makers with an aim to stop China's semiconductor sector advances, reports said. US might ban the export of tools to China used to make NAND chips. If amended, this would be first US step to target China's production of memory chips without specialised military apps through export controls.

163.title: Arvind Kejriwal promises free education and jobs in Gujarat
163.article_body: AAP convenor Arvind Kejriwal on Monday criticised BJP over unemployment and hooch tragedies in Gujarat. "I appeal to the people to choose AAP if you want free quality education and employment for your youth. You may vote for the BJP if you wish to feed them spurious liquor," said Kejriwal. He also promised unemployment allowance if AAP wins the polls.

164.title: Reduce fossil fuel use, adopt green energy for public transport: Gadkari
164.article_body: Road Transport Minister Nitin Gadkari stressed on the need to reduce fossil fuel consumption and adopt green energy for public transport and said the fare in electric buses can be 30% less than diesel ones. "Need to change country's transport system...Instead of petrol and diesel, we should focus on cheaper options like electricity, green hydrogen, ethanol and Bio-CNG," Gadkari added.

165.title: ED searches newspaper head office in Delhi in National Herald case
165.article_body: The Enforcement Directorate (ED) on Tuesday conducted searches at multiple places, including Herald House on Delhi's Bahadur Shah Zafar Marg, reports said. The searches were conducted in connection with ED's probe into the National Herald case under sections of the Prevention of Money Laundering Act (PMLA). Searches were conducted days after Congress President Sonia Gandhi was questioned in case.

166.title: Law student stabs classmate over love triangle in Lucknow university
166.article_body: A law student stabbed his classmate multiple times with a machete over an alleged love triangle at a private university in Lucknow. The victim suffered injuries around his neck, head and hands and has undergone multiple surgeries. The victim and accused had a fight a few days ago over a girl in their class. The accused is in custody.

167.title: Delhi's 1st monkeypox patient discharged: LNJP Hospital MD
167.article_body: Delhi's first monkeypox patient has been successfully discharged, Suresh Kumar, the Medical Director (MD) of the national capital's LNJP Hospital, said on Tuesday. He added that the man, who had no history of foreign travel, recovered in 25 days as "all symptoms waned away". This comes a day after a second monkeypox case was reported in Delhi.

168.title: Productivity at Google is not where it needs to be, there are real concerns: CEO
168.article_body: Google CEO Sundar Pichai at a recent all-hands meeting said, "There are real concerns that our productivity...is not where it needs to be for the headcount we have." Pichai asked employees to help "create a culture that is more mission-focused", CNBC reported. "We should think about how we can minimise distractions and really raise the bar on...productivity," he added.

169.title: Afghanistan needs India's help desperately: Taliban
169.article_body: Taliban militant Sirajuddin Haqqani said that Afghanistan "desperately" needs India's help, adding that India has a name in technology and trust in the international community that it fulfils its promises. "India has historical ties with Afghanistan. India had started some research and developmental programmes in Afghanistan...We want the unfinished projects...be...completed," he added.

170.title: We should be little kind to Hindi films: Alia on North vs South debate
170.article_body: Reacting to the North vs South debate, actress Alia Bhatt has said that it has been a tough year for Indian cinema. "We should be a little kind to Hindi films...Even in the South industry, all their films have not worked [this year]," she added. Alia further stated that a film with good content "always" does well.

171.title: Beyoncé to remove ableist lyric from new song 'Heated' amid backlash
171.article_body: Singer-songwriter Beyoncé has confirmed that she will change the lyrics of her new song 'Heated' which were called ableist and offensive by disability activists. The lyrics, co-written by Canadian singer Drake, have the line, "Spazzin' on that a**, spazz on that a**." "The word, not used intentionally in a harmful way, will be replaced," her statement read.

172.title: SC imposes ₹5 lakh fine on NGO over Noida's twin towers' petition
172.article_body: The Supreme Court asked an NGO to pay ₹5 lakh fine for filing a PIL seeking alteration of its year-old judgement directing demolition of Supertech twin towers in Noida Sector 93A. The petition urged court to utilise the 40-storey towers for some "national cause" instead of demolishing. The court asked the petitioner to deposit the amount within four weeks.

173.title: Water supply in parts of Pune to be shut off on Thursday
173.article_body: The water supply in parts of Pune will remain shut off on Thursday due to maintenance and repair work at the Parvati and Lashkar water stations. The water supply on Friday will be low pressure and delayed, Pune Municipal Corporation officials said. The areas which will get affected include Dattawadi, Rajendra Nagar, Mula Road, Koregaon Park, Wanawadi and others.

174.title: K'taka HC issues notices to Centre, state over detention of Sri Lankan citizens
174.article_body: Karnataka High Court has issued notices to the union and state governments over the alleged detention of Sri Lankan citizens in Bangalore Central Jail in Parappana Agrahara.
