The woman who runs the centre allegedly filmed the assault and blackmailed the complainant using the video to force her into prostitution. Police have filed a case and an investigation is underway.

351.title: Absolutely no chance of India going into recession: Finance Minister
351.article_body: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman during a price rise debate in Parliament said there is "absolutely zero probability of India slipping into recession" or stagflation. "Pandemic, [COVID-19] second wave, Omicron, Russia-Ukraine (war)...in spite of [all this], we've held inflation within 7% or below. That has to be recognised," said Sitharaman. The Indian economy has recovered admirably, she said.

352.title: Congress MPs walk out of Lok Sabha as FM Sitharaman speaks on rising prices
352.article_body: Congress MPs walked out of the Lok Sabha as Union Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman spoke on rising prices on Monday. "Pandemic, second wave, omicron, Russia-Ukraine (war)...even today largest supply components in China are under lockdown...in spite of that, we have held inflation well within 7% or below," she said. Sitharaman added that this has to be recognised.

353.title: RIL-owned logistics startup Grab.in integrates with ONDC
353.article_body: Reliance Retail owned logistics startup Grab.in has joined its platform with the Open Network for Digital Commerce (ONDC) network, a senior executive at the company said. The e-commerce platform is a subsidiary of Reliance Retail since its acquisitions by Reliance Industries in 2019. Prior to this, Reliance-backed Dunzo joined ONDC as a logistics partner.

354.title: US House Speaker Pelosi will visit Taiwan despite Chinese warnings: Reports
354.article_body: US House of Representatives Speaker Nancy Pelosi will visit Taiwan during her Asia tour, despite Chinese warnings, US media reported on Monday. The visit is definite, the Wall Street Journal reported, quoting a person familiar with the matter. China has said its military won't "sit idly by" if the top US official visits Taiwan, which it considers its own territory.

355.title: Made a mistake, forgive me: Maha Guv on 'Gujarati-Rajasthani' remark
355.article_body: Following criticism over his Gujarati-Rajasthani remarks, Maharashtra Governor Bhagat Singh Koshyari on Monday said, "I have made a mistake." Last week, he had said, "If Gujaratis and Rajasthanis are removed from Maharashtra...no money would be left here." "I don't even imagine that if I made any mistake unintentionally...that mistake would be considered as an insult to...Maharashtra," he added.

356.title: Who were the top bidders as govt sells 5G spectrum for over ₹1.5 lakh crore?
356.article_body: India's first-ever 5G spectrum auction concluded on Monday after seven days, with a total bid amount of ₹1,50,173 crore. Reliance Jio emerged the top bidder, acquiring 24,740 MHz spectrum worth ₹88,078 crore. Bharti Airtel acquired 19,867 MHz spectrum worth ₹43,084 crore. Vodafone Idea's bid was worth ₹18,799 crore, while Adani Group acquired 400 MHz spectrum worth ₹212 crore.

357.title: Indian IPO market for tech startups is nascent: Lightspeed's Somaia
357.article_body: Venture capital firm Lightspeed's de facto head of India operations, Bejul Somaia, in an interview said the IPO market for Indian tech companies is still nascent. Calling last year's tech IPOs a positive development, he said that the market still needed to deepen. With companies like Udaan, OYO, Razorpay, etc in its portfolio, Lightspeed recently closed a $500 million fund.

358.title: Centre forms special task force to monitor monkeypox cases
358.article_body: The Centre has formed a special task force to monitor monkeypox cases, officials said. The task force, which will be headed by NITI Aayog member (health) VK Paul, will also coordinate cases from states and provide any expertise that the states need. A 22-year-old man who had tested positive for monkeypox in the UAE died in Kerala's Thrissur on Saturday.

359.title: ED took action against Raut based on evidence: Maha Dy CM Fadnavis
359.article_body: Maharashtra Deputy CM Devendra Fadnavis on Monday said the ED's action against Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut was based on certain proofs and documents. "I would not comment on this issue further. His arrest and other related issues will be discussed in the court," said Fadnavis. Raut was arrested on Sunday night in connection with the Patra Chawl scam case.

360.title: TMC MP bites raw brinjal during Parliament debate on price rise, video released
360.article_body: TMC MP Kakoli Ghosh Dastidar on Monday bit on a raw brinjal during a Parliament debate on price rise. A video of the incident was released online, in which she's heard saying, "I'm talking about eating raw vegetables because LPG cylinder [price] has risen four times in four months." Government must understand what citizens are going through, she said.

361.title: Indian squash player Kuruvilla enters women's singles plate semis at CWG
361.article_body: Indian squash player Sunayna Kuruvilla beat Sri Lanka's Chanithma Sinaly 3-0 to reach the women's singles plate semi-final at the Commonwealth Games 2022 on Monday. Kuruvilla won the quarter-final match with a scoreline of 11-3, 11-2, 11-2. The 23-year-old will face Pakistan's Faiza Zafar on Tuesday. Zafar beat Guyana's Ashley Khalil 3-2 in the quarter-final.

362.title: Amber sells her home in US' California for $1.05 mn to pay Johnny Depp: Reports
362.article_body: Actress Amber Heard has reportedly sold her home in US' California after losing a defamation trial against ex-husband Johnny Depp in which she was ordered to pay him $8.3 million in damages. The property in Yucca Valley has been sold for $1.05 million (around ₹8.3 crore), reports said, adding that she bought it in 2019 for $5,70,000 (around ₹4.5 crore).

363.title: Have taken various steps to make India 'global drone hub' by 2030: Govt
363.article_body: The government has undertaken a series of reform measures to make India a global drone hub by 2030, Minister of State for Civil Aviation VK Singh said on Monday. Singh added that the Drone Airspace Map was published on September 24, 2021, opening up nearly 90% of Indian airspace as green zone for drones flying up to 400 feet.

364.title: Boxer Hussamuddin enters quarters in 57 kg featherweight at CWG 2022
364.article_body: Indian boxer Mohammed Hussamuddin reached the quarter-final in men's 57 kg featherweight category at the Commonwealth Games 2022 in Birmingham on Monday. Hussamuddin beat Bangladesh's Md Salim Hossain 5-0 in the round of 16. Earlier in the day, India's Amit Pangal defeated Vanuatu's Namri Berri 5-0 to enter the quarter-final in men's 51 kg flyweight category.

365.title: Zomato's consolidated loss nearly halves to ₹186 cr in Apr-Jun quarter
365.article_body: Zomato's consolidated net loss fell 47.8% YoY from ₹356.2 crore in Q1 FY22 to ₹185.7 crore in Q1 FY23. Zomato's consolidated revenue stood at ₹1,413.9 crore, rising by 67.44% YoY from ₹844.4 crore. Zomato CFO Akshant Goyal said growth in the food delivery platform's revenue was driven by a nearly 10% quarter-on-quarter growth in gross order value.

366.title: K'taka govt issues circular to check spread of monkeypox infection
366.article_body: Karnataka Health Minister Sudhakar K on Monday said a circular has been issued to Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike and all district administrations as a precautionary measure to check the spread of monkeypox infection. As per the circular, authorities have been asked to ensure enhanced surveillance, designated institutional isolation facilities, mandatory contact tracing and testing of samples.

367.title: Boxer Hussamuddin enters quarters in 57 kg featherweight at CWG 2022
367.article_body: Indian boxer Mohammed Hussamuddin reached the quarter-final in men's 57 kg featherweight category at the Commonwealth Games 2022 in Birmingham on Monday. Hussamuddin beat Bangladesh's Md Salim Hossain 5-0 in the round of 16. Earlier in the day, India's Amit Pangal defeated Vanuatu's Namri Berri 5-0 to enter the quarter-final in men's 51 kg flyweight category.

368.title: There was never a minute when I had headache as Delhi Police chief: Asthana
368.article_body: Former Delhi Police Commissioner Rakesh Asthana has said that there was never a minute when he had headache and wanted to quit the force. "Although I've retired today, I still believe I can do a lot more for the Delhi Police, the people and the country," he added. Senior IPS officer Sanjay Arora took charge as the new Commissioner.

369.title: 2nd West Indies-India T20I postponed by 2 hours as team luggage doesn't arrive on time
369.article_body: The second West Indies-India T20I has been postponed by two hours and is now scheduled to begin at 10 pm tonight, instead of 8 pm at Warner Park in St Kitts today. Cricket West Indies (CWI) said that the match has been postponed because of significant delays in "crucial" team luggage arriving into St Kitts from Trinidad.

370.title: Video of Paytm employees burning PhonePe's QR codes surfaces, police complaint lodged
370.article_body: UPI leader PhonePe filed a police complaint against some employees of Paytm, alleging that they burnt PhonePe's QR codes. The incident is said to have taken place in Greater Noida. A video of the incident has surfaced online. PhonePe said that it identified three Paytm employees, including an ex-PhonePe employee. Paytm said it suspended the employees pending a detailed investigation.

371.title: Raut is the Shiv Sainik who won’t bend: Uddhav on Raut’s arrest
371.article_body: Shiv Sena chief Uddhav Thackeray on Monday said that he's proud of Sanjay Raut, adding that he's a real Shiv Sainik who won't bend. “There’s a dialogue in ‘Pushpa’ - “jhukega nahi”. Those who used to say they won’t bend are all that side today.” he said. Thackeray criticised the BJP for trying to muzzle the voices of dissent.

372.title: Delhi man intensifies crime to buy scooter for sister on Raksha Bandhan
372.article_body: A 21-year-old history-sheeter allegedly intensified his criminal activities in Delhi, so that he could buy an electric scooter for his sister on Raksha Bandhan, police said on Monday. With the accused's arrest, police claim to have solved six criminal cases, and also recovered three stolen mobile phones and a motorcycle from him.

373.title: B'luru to see regular power cuts in August due to maintenance work
373.article_body: Bengaluru is expected to witness regular power cuts throughout August due to maintenance work by Karnataka Power Transmission Corporation Limited. According to Bengaluru's power distribution company BESCOM, the work will be undertaken nearly every day of the month from 9 am to 6 pm. As per BESCOM, its Koramangala, Indiranagar, Kanakapura and Whitefield divisions, among others, will be affected.

374.title: Teen dies after drowning in swimming pool in Hyderabad's Narsingi
374.article_body: A 14-year-old boy died on Sunday after drowning in a swimming pool at a gated community in Hyderabad's Narsingi, police informed. According to police, the boy was pulled out of the pool by his cousin who saw him struggling in the water on Saturday when they visited the pool. The teenager was later hospitalised but died during treatment, police added.

375.title: Realtor shot dead by business associate in Hyderabad's Madhapur
375.article_body: A real estate dealer named Mohammad Ismail was allegedly shot dead by his business associate over a suspected property dispute in Hyderabad's Madhapur area during the early hours of Monday. Police found in its preliminary probe that both the victim and the accused had several criminal cases registered against them. The accused and his associate are absconding, police said.

376.title: Bengaluru reports 1,154 new COVID-19 cases, positivity rate at 7.3%
376.article_body: Bengaluru reported 1,154 fresh cases of COVID-19 with a positivity rate of 7.31% on Sunday, data shared by Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) chief Tushar Giri Nath said. As per the data, no new deaths were recorded due to the infection in the city on Sunday. Bengaluru's active case count stands at 8,595, data showed.

377.title: The more I bowled spin, the more I looked at Muralidaran: Narine
377.article_body: KKR spinner Sunil Narine revealed that he used to look up to Sri Lankan spinner Muthiah Muralidaran when the former was starting out his career as a spin bowler. "The more I bowled spin, the more I looked to Muralidaran...he had the ball going both ways. But in the beginning, it was tough [in West Indies]," Narine said.

378.title: 2nd seed Sinner beats top seed Alcaraz to win 1st title of 2022 in Croatia
378.article_body: Second-seeded Jannik Sinner beat top-seeded Carlos Alcaraz 6-7(5-7), 6-1, 6-1 to win Plava Laguna Croatia Open Umag on Sunday. It was the 20-year-old's first title of the season. "I'm obviously very happy. I have (had) a tough year until now," said Sinner. The win was the Italian's second against Alcaraz in four weeks. Overall, it was Sinner's sixth title.

379.title: Google Maps to share speed limit info with users in B'luru, Chandigarh
379.article_body: Google Maps will now display speed limit information to its users in Bengaluru and Chandigarh as part of a partnership between Google and the traffic police departments of Bengaluru and Chandigarh. Google will reportedly extend the pilot project to Kolkata and Hyderabad in the coming months. The project has already reduced 20% wait time for commuters, Bengaluru traffic police said.

380.title: Judoka Shushila Devi assures India of another CWG medal, to fight for gold tonight
380.article_body: Judoka Shushila Devi has assured India of another medal at the ongoing Commonwealth Games (CWG) 2022. She defeated Mauritian judoka Priscilla Morand by IPPON in the semi-final of the women's 48-kg category to reach the final. She will face Michaela Whitebooi of South Africa in the gold medal match after 9.30 pm (IST) tonight.

381.title: Tesla CEO Musk says engagement on Twitter has dropped recently
381.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk said interaction with almost all Twitter accounts "seem to be much lower in recent weeks and days". Musk asked in a tweet if users think his analysis is "accurate". Reacting to Musk's tweet, a user wrote, "Nah, Elon. We're just actively ignoring you." Another user wrote, "It's because markets have been down. It'll come back."

382.title: India's first-ever 5G spectrum auction ends, total bids cross ₹1.5 lakh crore
382.article_body: India's first-ever 5G spectrum auction has concluded, Union Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw said on Monday. The total bid amount for the sale of airwaves was over ₹1.5 lakh crore at the end of the auction. Out of the 72 GHz of the spectrum that was put up for auction, around 51 GHz has been sold, Vaishnaw said.

383.title: Death toll in fire at Madhya Pradesh hospital rises to 9
383.article_body: At least nine people died after a massive fire broke out at a private hospital in Madhya Pradesh's Jabalpur on Monday, Superintendent of Police (SP) Siddharth Bahuguna said. Two injured persons have been shifted to a nearby hospital for treatment. The SP said prima facie, it appears that a short circuit caused the blaze. The fire has been doused.

384.title: He would cry for meat, but we couldn't afford it: Mother of CWG gold medallist Achinta
384.article_body: After Indian weightlifter Achinta Sheuli bagged gold medal for India at CWG 2022, his mother Purnima said, "If one day he had rice on his plate, then he would not have any vegetables with it." She added, "Some days it would be eggs, while meat was something my son would cry for, but we could not afford it."

385.title: Pune Police rolls back guidelines for Ganesh Chaturthi festival
385.article_body: The Pune Police has rolled back its guidelines for the upcoming 10-day Ganesh Chaturthi celebrations, three days after issuing them. "Considering the demands raised by Ganpati mandals, we will soon issue fresh guidelines for this year's Ganpati festival," said Pune Police Joint Commissioner Sandeep Karnik. Earlier, only two box 'kamans' were permitted per Ganpati mandal in the city.

386.title: Amit Panghal enters quarterfinals in flyweight category at CWG 2022
386.article_body: Indian boxer Amit Panghal defeated Vanuatu's Namri Berri to enter the quarterfinals in the men's 48kg-51kg (flyweight) category at the Commonwealth Games (CWG) 2022 on Monday. Panghal won the round of 16 in a unanimous decision (5-0). The 26-year-old will next face Scottish boxer Lennon Mulligan in the quarterfinals.

387.title: Sanjay Raut tampered with evidence: ED in its 8-day custody plea
387.article_body: Seeking eight-day custody for Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut, the ED in its plea said that Raut was tampering with evidence and influenced several crucial witnesses in the money laundering case. ED was granted custody of Raut till August 4, who was arrested on Sunday night in a money laundering case related to the Patra Chawl land scam case.

388.title: Andhra ex-CM NTR's daughter Uma found dead at her Hyderabad home
388.article_body: Telugu Desam Party (TDP) founder and former CM of Andhra Pradesh NT Rama Rao's (NTR's) daughter Uma Maheshwari was found dead at her residence in Hyderabad on Monday. Uma was the youngest among actor-turned-politician NTR's 12 children. Her body has been shifted to a local hospital for postmortem, reports said.

389.title: Delhi BJP leaders sit on dharna outside Kejriwal's home
389.article_body: Delhi BJP leaders sat on a dharna outside CM Arvind Kejriwal's home demanding that Deputy CM Manish Sisodia and minister Satyendar Jain be removed over charges of alleged corruption. Jain is currently in judicial custody in a case of alleged money laundering registered by the Enforcement Directorate (ED). Kejriwal was in Gujarat to address a public rally in Rajkot.

390.title: MP CM announces ex-gratia of ₹5 lakh for families of 4 killed in hospital fire
390.article_body: Madhya Pradesh CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan on Monday announced ex-gratia of ₹5 lakh each for the families of four people who died after a massive fire broke out at a private hospital in Jabalpur. At least three other people were seriously injured in the fire. The fire began at the entrance of the hospital located near Shiv Nagar Damoh Naka.

391.title: Uddhav backs Sanjay Raut, calls him a true ‘Shiv Sainik’
391.article_body: After Shiv Sena MP Sanjay Raut’s arrest, former Maharashtra Chief Minister Uddhav Thackeray criticised BJP and claimed that the saffron party is trying to muzzle voices of the dissent. "Using CBI, ED and other agencies to repress dissent is not democracy,” said Uddhav. He further added that he is proud of Raut and called him a true ‘Shiv Sainik’.

392.title: China warns its military 'won't sit idly' if Pelosi visits Taiwan
392.article_body: Chinese Foreign Ministry, during a regular briefing, has said that its military "won't sit idly" if US House Speaker Nancy Pelosi visits Taiwan. A spokesperson of the ministry said that due to Pelosi's status as "No 3 official of US government", a visit to Taiwan would "lead to egregious political impact". This comes as Pelosi began an Asian tour.

393.title: Boeing to develop research facility in Japan to develop sustainable fuel
393.article_body: Boeing will establish a research and development centre in Japan with an aim to further develop sustainable aviation fuel (SAF). In a news release, US aircraft manufacturer said that the facility will focus on robotics, digitalisation and automation. Sustainable aviation fuel uses feedstock like animal fat and cooking oil which is more expensive than conventional jet fuel.

394.title: 20 quarantined in Kerala after youth dies of monkeypox
394.article_body: Following the death of a person due to monkeypox in Kerala, 20 people have been put under quarantine in Thrissur. “The situation is under control, there's no panic here. The deceased had direct contact with 10 people including the family members,” officials said. Meanwhile, the Centre formed a task force on monkeypox to closely monitor the situation in the country.

395.title: 126 Venezuelan migrants including 9 women deported from Mexico
395.article_body: Mexico has deported 126 Venezuelan migrants, including nine women, who were not able to prove their legal entry, the country's National Migration Institute said in a statement. The migrants boarded a flight early Saturday, it added. According to the UN, over six million Venezuelans have fled from their home country to escape violence as well as lack of essential services.

396.title: Holiday for educational institutions in parts of Kerala amid rains
396.article_body: A holiday has been declared for educational institutions in parts of Kerala on Monday amid heavy rainfall. District Collectors of Pathanamthitta and Kollam declared August 1 as a holiday for educational institutions in certain taluks in their respective districts. In Ernakulam, all departments have been directed to be prepared and fishermen have been instructed not to venture into the sea.

397.title: Shooting while pregnant was quite a task: Alia on 'Heart of Stone'
397.article_body: Speaking about her upcoming Hollywood film 'Heart of Stone', actress Alia Bhatt said that she had quite a task at hand since she was pregnant during the shoot. She added that there were many layers for her to deal with due to her pregnancy. "But they made it so seamless and so easy and so comfortable for me," Alia said.

398.title: Gambhir asked me to open, opposition didn't take me seriously: Sunil Narine
398.article_body: Talking about his batting, West Indies spinner Sunil Narine said he was first tried out as an opener in BBL, and then Gautam Gambhir asked him to open for KKR in IPL 2017. "Gambhir wanted me to get the team off to a fast start...opposition didn't take me that seriously...[but] I went from strength to strength," added Narine.

399.title: Dalit woman sexually harassed, forced to undress at gunpoint in UP; 7 arrested
399.article_body: A 30-year-old Dalit woman was allegedly sexually harassed and forced to remove her clothes at gunpoint in Uttar Pradesh's Muzaffarnagar. The miscreants also recorded the act on a mobile phone camera, police said. The matter came to the fore after the incident's video was circulated on social media. Police arrested seven persons in connection with the incident on Sunday.

400.title: National Awards jury members are just Bollywood fans: Adoor Gopalakrishnan
400.article_body: Filmmaker Adoor Gopalakrishnan has stated that now the National Awards jury comprises anonymous Bollywood fans "playing...jokes". He further said that earlier the jury consisted of well-known directors, theatre artists and critics. "[Now] some random person becomes the chairman of the jury that gives awards to some people...everyone knows the exact reason (why they got the awards)," he added.
